title: Guided non-judgmental mirror exposure therapy
intention: focus on describing body parts using non-judgemental language
prompts: it may be uncomfortable, but if you are willing, please wear garments that will allow you to have a clear reflection of you
alright, are you ready?
let's start by relaxing your body
unclench your jaw
drop your shoulders, shake your hands if you'd like
breath in, breath out
remember, you're navigating this at your own pace
today, you will be focusing on your individual body parts and describing it using neutral language

neutral language as in, terms that simply describe your body's characteristics without making any value judgments or comparisons to others

use descriptions that would help someone build a model of you
let's take a look at your reflection

starting with your head, use neutral language to describe the shapes and colors of your head

for instance, what is your hair color? what shape are your lips and eyes?

now, use neutral language to describe the shapes and color of your torso

for instance, what shape best describes your torso?

now, use neutral language to describe the shapes and colors of the bottom section of your body

for instance, what shape best describes your legs?
if there were areas that you weren't as ready to talk about today, it's alright, come back to them when you're ready

reflection time (please answer as your comfort allows)!

were there any areas you spent more time on and why?
how are you feeling now that you've practiced describing your body using neutral language?

well done

being kind to yourself may not be easy but you're learning how to embrace yourself step-by-step!

title: Pure mirror exposure therapy
intention: comment about emotions looking at body
prompts: it may be uncomfortable, but if you are willing, please wear garments that will allow you to have a clear reflection of you
let's start by relaxing your body
unclench your jaw
drop your shoulders, shake your hands if you'd like
now, let's take some slow deep breaths
breath in, breath out
remember, you're navigating this at your own pace
today, you will be describing and commenting on the emotions (neutral, positive and/or negative) you experience while looking at your body
let's take a look at your reflection
starting with your head, describe the feelings that are evoked when you look at all the features at this part of your body
it's valid if these feelings are negative! we need to acknowledge our negative thoughts to be able to accept and overcome it
now, moving onto your torso area. once more, what sorts of emotions are evoked when you look here?
now, you're at the bottom section of your body. looking at your features here, are there any emotions that are evoked?
as mentioned, it's fine have to difficult thoughts and emotions attached to your body

again, it's alright if you have any difficult thoughts and emotions attached to your body

we're working towards letting go all of it

well done

we're ourselves' biggest critics and it's difficult to face our thoughts and emotions, but you did it!

title: Mirror exposure with a positive focus
intention: saying 'I love' statements about your body
prompts: it may be uncomfortable, but if you are willing, please wear garments that will allow you to have a clear reflection of you
let's start by relaxing your body
unclench your jaw
drop your shoulders, shake your hands if you'd like
now, let's take some slow deep breaths
breath in, breath out
remember, you're navigating this at your own pace
today, you will be focusing on your favorite parts of your body and practice using positive reinforcement
let's take a look at your reflection

starting with your head, use "i love" statements and point out the features you love about your head area

for example, "i love my sharp eyes
moving to your torso area, same thing, use "i love" statements to describe the features you love here
now at your lower body, use "i love" statements to describe your favorite features here

reflection time:

did you surprise yourself with any "i love" statements?
are there specific areas you want to learn how to love about your body?
what are you in the process of learning how to love about your body?

well done

cultivating self-love and compassion takes time. soon, you will come to love your entirety!
